meta.title: Jing's Blog
meta.subtitle: To note down my daily improvement
meta.author: Jing Xu

pages.title: About
pages.text: Who am I I am a researcher at University of Copenhagen, and working in the area of forest genetics and tree breeding. What is this website for This website is build to explore a better way to learn. There are so many things happening every day, and I am curious of so many things, and always want to give it a try. But I figure out that I am not so organized, and I easily lost track on what I have done. In this way, I create this blog to help me to remember what I have been doing, and hopefully help me to improve more efficiently.

posts.title: Literature review-genomic selection in wheat breeding
posts.excerpt: Literature overview Title: The value of early-stage phenotyping for wheat breeding in the age of genomic selection Author: Borrenpohl Daniel, Huang Mao, Olson Eric, Sneller Clay Institute: Department of Horticulture and Crop Science, Ohio Agriculture Research and Development Center, The Ohio State University, USA Journal: Theor Appl Genet Date: 01 June 2020 DOI: https://doi.org/10.1007/s00122-020-03613-0
posts.text: Literature overview Title: The value of early-stage phenotyping for wheat breeding in the age of genomic selection Author: Borrenpohl Daniel, Huang Mao, Olson Eric, Sneller Clay Institute: Department of Horticulture and Crop Science, Ohio Agriculture Research and Development Center, The Ohio State University, USA Journal: Theor Appl Genet Date: 01 June 2020 DOI: https://doi.org/10.1007/s00122-020-03613-0 Introduction Genomic selection Genomic selection was first proposed by Meuwissen et al. (2001). Theodorus Meuwissen is a professor at Norwegian University of Life Sciences, in the area of animal genetics. Here is a video of his presentation about genomic selection: Summary from presentation of Meuwissen Why MAS (marker assistant selection) not the solution Traits of interest are complex with many genes controlled, and affected by environment Detection of QTL (quantitative traits loci) explain only small fraction of genetic variation Three breakthroughs he mentioned Detection of large number of SNP marker‚Äî Byproduct of sequencing efforts SNP-chip genotyping technology ‚Äî Affordable to genotype 50, 000 SNPs Development of GS/ GP technology Some key features of GS SNP effects are not tested for statistical significance ‚Äî all SNP effects are used $\geqslant$ all genetic variance are addressed Accurate GEBV for individuals without records ‚Äî decouples elite breeding from recording Invasive recordings Late in life records Sex limited traits No pedigree recoding needed, because pedigree is replaced by marker based relationships Statistic model linear regression: SNP-BLUP $\equiv$ GBLUP $$ y_i= \mu+X_{1x}* b_1 + X_{2i}* b_2 + ‚Ä¶ + X_{5000000} * b_{50000} + e_i $$ $$ GEBV_j= X_{1j}* b_1 + X_{2j} * b_2 + ‚Ä¶ + X_{500000j}*b_{500000} $$ ‚≠êall SNPs are same, and have the same constant variation, with mean of 0. non-linear regression -Bayes A, Bayes B, Bayes C $$ y_i = I_1 * X_{i1}* b_1 + I_2 * X_{i2} * b_2 + ‚Ä¶ + I_{500000} * X_{i500000} * b_{500000} + e_i $$ $I_j=0/1$ is an indicator whether SNP j has effect or not Prior information is that fraction $\pi$ of SNPs have effect & $(1-\pi)$ have no effect Try to give extra weight to some SNPs and less to others Simulation studies: GBLUP < Bayes A <Bayes C Real data studies show: Differences small often GBLUP is as good as BayesA/B Theoretically: If few and dense SNPs, BayesB is best If many genes / not enough density: GBLUP best Precision breeding (Flint & Woolliams, 2007) Accurate GEBV Avoid deleterious side effects from breeding ‚Äî select for broad breeding goal Manage genetic variation ‚Äî Realize precision breeding also into the future In GS, a training population (TP) is formed if individuals who are phenotyped and genotyped with molecular markers. Those data are co-analyzed to build a prediction model. The model can then be used to predict the trait value of unphenotyped individuals that are related to the TP and have been genotyped with the same markers. The GS model calculates genomic estimated breeding values (GEBVs) for the unphenotyped individuals that can be used for selection in the same manner as phenotypic data. link of image: https://wiki.groenkennisnet.nl/display/TAB/Chapter+8.15.1%3A+Principle+of+genomic+selection Application of GS in plant breeding Population improvement phase The first application is for the population improvement phase of a program where recombination creates new genetic variation and testable progeny are generated. GS in this phase can increase the rate of genetic gain by reducing the duration of a recurrent selection breeding cycle. Product development phase ‚Äî field testing GS can also be applied to the product development phase of breeding where progeny are evaluated for performance in a stage-gate process. GS could enhance field trial selection by integrating genotypic and phenotypic data as opposed to advancing lines using phenotypic data alone. Obejectives Compare the prediction accuracy of GS and phenotyping in stage-1 and stage-2 field evaluations Assess the value of stage-1 phenotyping for advancing lines to stage-2 testing Materials and methods Training population: 1769 wheat breeding lines (genotyped +phenotypes) Traits: yield, test weight, Fusarium head blight resistance, heading date, and height. SNP discovery: 400 randomly selected lines was first used for single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) discovery by comparing their sequences to the wheat reference genome in the TASSEL-GBS pipeline (Glaubitz et al. 2014). In total, ~ 190,000 SNPs were detected. SNP cleaning: Only SNPs with less than 20% missing data and greater than 0.05 minor allele frequency were retained. Missing marker scores were imputed using an expectation‚Äìmaximization algorithm in R package rrBLUP (v. 4.6) using the ‚ÄúA.mat‚Äù function (Endelman 2011). To ensure even marker genome coverage and reduce marker redundancy, a SNP tagging procedure using a threshold of r = 0.8 was conducted to identify the most informative markers (Rinaldo et al. 2005; Huang et al. 2016). After this tagging procedure, a total of 12,037 high-quality and evenly distributed SNPs were used for analysis. Population structure: Population structure among all 1769 lines was assessed using principal component analysis of the marker data in the R stats package (v. 3.5.3) using the ‚Äúprcomp‚Äù function (R Core Development Team 2019). Modeling: GS models were built using R package rrBLUP (v. 4.6) to estimate marker effects for each trait using ridge regression BLUP (RR-BLUP) using the ‚Äúmixed.solve‚Äù function (Endelman, 2011). RR-BLUP was chosen primarily for computational efficiency because Huang et al. (2016) found that RR-BLUP had comparable accuracy to other GS models for all wheat traits in the Ohio State University breeding program. Conclusion In conclusion, GS is proving to be a valuable tool for improving the efficiency of the population improvement and product development phases of breeding field trials. Introducing GS into a program can have a dramatic benefit to a breeding program. But applying GS requires a thorough assessment of the impact of GS on genetic gain, cost per unit of gain, allocation of field-testing resources, and operational considerations in all phases of breeding phases.

posts.title: Dansk ord hver dag 2
posts.excerpt: Nye danske ord Jeg l√¶rer nye ord hver eneste dag.
posts.text: Nye danske ord Jeg l√¶rer nye ord hver eneste dag. At l√∏ntilskudsjobbet i Frederiksberg passer ham str√•lende, er let at fornemme. l√∏ntilskudsjob b√∏jning -bet, - eller -s, -bene betygninger: tidsbegr√¶nset ans√¶ttelse af en arbejdsl√∏s i en virksomhed eller institution til en l√∏n der svarer til arbejdsl√∏shedsdagpengene, med det form√•l at forbedre den p√•g√¶ldendes kompetencer og muligheder for varig ans√¶ttelse. tidsbegr√¶nset: fixed term ans√¶ttelse: employment p√•g√¶ldende adj betygninger: in question | concerned | relevant Eksempler: de p√•g√¶ldende ¬ª the parties concerned | den p√•g√¶ldende ¬ª the person in question ‚Äã Han p√•stod i retten, at han intet kunne huske om den p√•g√¶ldende aften. ‚Äã St√•r du over for en bevidstl√∏s person, har du pligt at yde f√∏rstehj√¶lp i det omfang, du kan. Du m√• ikke forlade den p√•g√¶ldende. p√•g√• verbum Overs√¶ttelser be underway - A more thorough investigation is already underway (foreg√•) be going on - I think something is going on in the basement (v√¶re i gang) be in progress - The scheme is in progress (finde sted) take place - These events are taking place as we speak str√•lende adjektiv Betydninger: fremragende; fantaktisk god Ord i n√¶rheden: imponerende | flot | bem√¶rkelsesv√¶rdig | respektindgydende | respektfuld | admirabel Eksempler: str√•lende id√© | str√•lende vejr | have det str√•lende | hun ser str√•lende ud Alting var s√• str√•lende, min kone og jeg var meget lykkelige. Overs√¶ttelser (radiant) - Her beauty was radiant (skinnende) bright - The sun was bright and shiny (funklende) sparkling - The sky was full of sparkling starts (funklende) glittering - Her glittering jewels looked their best in the spotlight (sk√¶rende) glaring - The glaring flashlight was too sharp for his eyes (fremragende) splendid - The champagne was a splendid choice (fremragende) excellent - That was an excellent meal (fremragende) brilliant - She has so many brilliant ideas (imponerende) spectacular - He had a spectacular mind (bl√¶ndende) dazzling - Everybody was talking about her dazzling performance (storartet) great - That is a great idea (storsl√•et) magnificent - He looked magnificent at the party (herlig) glorious - It was a glorious victory str√•le verbum Betydninger: udsende st√¶rkt lys; skinne med smuk og st√¶rk glans Ord i n√¶rheden: v√¶kke beundring | knejse | prange | lyse op | funkle | blomstre Eksempler: Solen str√•ler fra en skyfri himmel. begavelse substantiv, f√¶llesk√∏n ‚Äã Synonymintelligens ‚Äã adj: begavet person sp√¶ndende adj fornemme verbum ‚Äã B√∏jning: -r, -de, -t ‚Äã Overs√¶ttelser (sanse) sense perceive (bem√¶rke) notice (f√∏le) feel fornem adj Overs√¶ttelser _ distinguished - The hotel expected a distinguished guest _ (√¶del, adelig) noble - The noble guests paraded on the lawn _ (fremragende) brilliant - The actor made a brilliant performance _ (fremragende) grand - They thought the meal was grand * posh - They were staying at a posh hotel Jeg f√∏ler mig tryg og mega-godt tilpas p√• arbejdet fastsl√•r verbum Overs√¶ttelser ( bestemme) determine - The police have not determined the cause of the accident (erkl√¶re) state - The terms of the agreement are stated in the contract ( sl√• fast) make clear - He made it clear that no insubordination would be tolerated ( p√•vise) demonstrate - Researchers have demonstrated the dangers of smoking ( p√•vise) establish - We have established where the accident took place ( p√•vise) show - We have shown that the accused is not guilty ( p√•vise) prove - They proved that the new medicine had no effect ( konstatere) ascertain - The judge tried to ascertain the truth Hans indgang til det danske arbejdsmarked bliver ikke lettere af, at han var analfabet, da han p√•begyndte sin danskundervisning. analfabet substantiv Betydninger: person over 15 √•r der ikke kan l√¶se og skrive jobbet giver ham mere end trivsel i hverdagen trivsel substantiv, f√¶llesk√∏n Overs√¶ttelser _ welfare - My client‚Äôs welfare is my primary concern (Min klients trivsel er det vigtigste for mig) _ well-being - She was only interested in the well-being of the child (Hun var kun interesseret i barnets trivsel) _ satisfaction - Job satisfaction is a keyword at the moment (Trivsel er et n√∏gleord p√• arbejdspladsen for tiden) _ well-being - He was concerned about the well-being of his children (Han var bekymret for sine b√∏rns trivsel) * (p√• arbejdsplads) job satisfaction - Her sense of job satisfaction had increased over the year (Hendes f√∏lelse af trivsel p√• arbejdet var steget det seneste √•r) Det giver ogs√• langsomt, men sikkert- et bedre dansk, som supplerer den undervisning, han f√•r og som styrker hans evne til at kommunikere i hverdagen styrke subtantiv, f√¶llesk√∏n Overs√¶ttelser strength - His strength was amazing (Hans styrke var forbl√∏ffende) [Figurativt] (om kompetence) strength - Mathematics and chemistry have never been my strength (Matematik og kemi har aldrig v√¶ret min styrke) (fysisk, ofte voldsom kraft) force - They were overwhelmed by the force of the wind (De blev overv√¶ldet af vindens styrke) (kraft) power - The power of his grip was impressive (Hans h√•ndtryks styrke var imponerende) (briller, kikkert, mikroskop) power - The power of her spectacle glasses was too weak (Styrken i hendes brilleglas var for svag) Han g√•r fortsat til danskundervisning fortsat adv forts√¶tte verbum B√∏jning -r, fortsatte, fortsat Overs√¶ttelser continue - The company continued the production (Firmaet fortsatte produktionen) go on - The increase in oil prices is expected to go on (Olieprisernes stigning forventes at forts√¶tte) carry on - They decided to carry on with the project (De besluttede at forts√¶tte med projektet) proceed - The man chose to proceed with his plans (Manden valgte at forts√¶tte med sine planer) (blive ved) persist - Her problems with reading persisted throughout her adolescence (Hendes problemer med at l√¶se, fortsatte gennem hele hendes pubertet) Efterh√•nden forst√•r jeg bedre den by, jeg bor i. Jeg kan l√¶se skilte og forst√• dem. Mit problem er nok, at jeg ikke har s√• mange at tale dansk med i fritiden - det er mest p√• arbejdet og p√• sprogskolen. Arbejdet g√∏r mig gladere, selvom det stadig kan v√¶re sv√¶rt at udtrykke alle mine tanker. Hvis du sp√∏rger mig, er dansk det sv√¶reste sprog i verden! Vokalerne er meget sv√¶re at udtale, synes jeg. Men det g√•r hele tiden bedre.

posts.title: Dansk ord hver dag 1
posts.excerpt: Nye danske ord I will try to keep to note down the new danish words I learned everyday. Her er de nye danske ord jeg har l√¶rte i dag. 1.skoleforl√∏be substantiv, b√∏jning: -et, -, -ene Periode hvor en person g√•r i grundskole, ligesom skoletid F.eks: Eleverne starter meget tidligt med engelsk i deres skoleforl√∏be.
posts.text: Nye danske ord I will try to keep to note down the new danish words I learned everyday. Her er de nye danske ord jeg har l√¶rte i dag. 1.skoleforl√∏be substantiv, b√∏jning: -et, -, -ene Periode hvor en person g√•r i grundskole, ligesom skoletid F.eks: Eleverne starter meget tidligt med engelsk i deres skoleforl√∏be. 2.rykke rykke ind i - move into f.eks: Vi er ikke rykket ind i den nye bygning endnu. rykke sammen/t√¶ttere/n√¶rmere-move closer f.eks: Hvis vi rykker sammen, holder vi varmen. rykke tilbage- move back, draw back f.eks: G√∏r klar til at rykke tilbage! (let‚Äôs prepare to move back!) Du m√• rykke lidt tilbage. Du m√• rykke deres stol tilbage. V√¶r venlig at rykke tilbage! Hvis du har brug for at placere babyautostolen p√• passagers√¶det, skal du s√∏ge for at rykke s√¶det s√• langet tilbage som muligt. rykke frem - advance, move forward. f.eks: Kan vi rykke m√∏det frem. rykke ned -move down, be relegated. f.eks: Alle mine venner vil grine ad mig fordi jeg er rykket ned. rykke op - move up, be promoted. f.eks: Jeg mangler 5 niveaupoint for at kunne rykke op til silver-niveauet. rykke ud- pull out (tr√¶kke op), turn out. f.eks: F√• alle gjordt klar til at rykke ud. rykke teltp√¶lene op: pull up stakes. F.eks: De var n√∏dt til at rykke teltp√¶lene op og begynde igen i en ny by. For√¶ldre rykker teltp√¶lene op og flytter t√¶ttere p√• b√∏rn og b√∏rneb√∏rn. 3.bev√¶ge move: L√¶gen bad mig om at bev√¶ge min arm. Sv√∏mning er en motionsform, hvor man bev√¶ger hele kroppen. travel: Lavaen bev√¶gede sig langsomt ned af bakken. work: Han begyndte at bev√¶ge sig ned ad bakken. wag: L√¶reren bev√¶gede fingeren. waggle: Musikken ik hende til at bev√¶ge foden. 4.accelerere: speed up 5.passagers√¶de: passenger seat 6.sj√¶lden: rare 7.otium-retirement f.eks: Nyde sit otium. 8.imidlertid: however, still, meanwhile, in the meantime

posts.title: Dansk stavelsesdeling
posts.excerpt: Vokaler, Konsonant, og Stavelsesdeling Vokaler og konsonanter Der er kun to typer af bogstaver at holde styr p√• i dansk alfabet: vokaler og konsonanter. Alligevel kan de vokaler og konsonanter volde besv√¶rligheder for folk fra andre lande. JEG ER EN AF DEM! üò¢ üò≠ üòø Men faktisk er det ikke kun sv√¶rt for udl√¶ndinge til at l√¶re danske, det er ogs√• sv√¶rt for danske sm√•b√∏rn. Forskning viser nemlig, at danske b√∏rn er l√¶ngere om at l√¶re at forst√• og tale deres modersm√•l end andre b√∏rn i Europa.
posts.text: Vokaler, Konsonant, og Stavelsesdeling Vokaler og konsonanter Der er kun to typer af bogstaver at holde styr p√• i dansk alfabet: vokaler og konsonanter. Alligevel kan de vokaler og konsonanter volde besv√¶rligheder for folk fra andre lande. JEG ER EN AF DEM! üò¢ üò≠ üòø Men faktisk er det ikke kun sv√¶rt for udl√¶ndinge til at l√¶re danske, det er ogs√• sv√¶rt for danske sm√•b√∏rn. Forskning viser nemlig, at danske b√∏rn er l√¶ngere om at l√¶re at forst√• og tale deres modersm√•l end andre b√∏rn i Europa. Hvorfor er det sv√¶rt ved at l√¶re det danske sprog. ‚ùì Hemmeligheden ligger f√∏rst og fremmest i vokalerne. Udl√¶ndinge og sm√• b√∏rn kl√∏jes i de fine vokalnuancer, som det danske sprog er pr√¶get af. Vokaler Vokalerne er lette at identificere. Vokalernes lyd kan tr√¶kkes ud og ikke √¶ndrer sig, n√•r synger dem. Ligesom ekempelvis det engelseke sprog, A, E, I, O, U, Y er vokaler i danske sprog. Men der er tre flere vokaler i danske: **√¶,√∏ **og √•. Historie om √Ö if√∏lge til DAGENSDK √Ö skrev som Aa f√∏r 1948. F√∏rst i 1955 blev det skrevet som √•, derefor kom √• fra forrest til bagerst i alfabetet. Konsonanter De 20 konsonanter er: B, C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, Q, R, S, T, V, W, X, Z Stavelsesdele Det er velkendte at dansk er et sv√¶rt sprog. Men faktiske p√• papiret er dansk ikke specielt sv√¶rt at forst√•, men det samme g√∏r sig desv√¶rre ikke g√¶ldende, n√•r vi taler. B√•de vokalerne og nogle af konsonantbogstaverne g√•r igen som lydskrift; man kan dog ikke regne med at bogstaverne altid lyder som man forventer. Selvom er der kun 9 vokaler og 20 konsonanter. Men if√∏lge til forskerne fra Center for B√∏rnesprog p√• SDU, at det danske sprog har: 22 forskellige vokallyde 17 forskellige konsonanterlyde Man skal dele ord i stavelser, n√•r ordene er lange. I f√∏lgende er de regler med stavelsesdeling: Ved 1 konsonant, f√∏lger den med den bagerste vokal: F. eks: ba - nan Ved 2 konsonanter deles: F. eks: mal - ke Dog kan begge konsonanter f√∏lge med den bagerste vokal, hvis konsonanten h√∏res der: F. eks: ma -tros ta -ske Ved 3 konsonanter: F.eks: skor-sten Ved 4 konsonanter: F.eks: pind-svin Vokallyde Der er et meget godt vokalskema p√• Danske Frederiksdund: Konsonantlyde N√•r konsonanterne st√•r allerforrest i et ord, har de som hovedregel den lyd man forventer; i ordene hest , g√¶st svarer bogstavet h alts√• til lyden [h], bogstavet g til lyden [gÃä]. Bogstavet p udtales ogs√• [p ∞] n√•r det st√•r f√∏rst i et ord, som fx i pose. Men bogstavet p udtales som b [bÃ•] n√•r det ikke st√•r f√∏rst i ordet, som fx stoppe. Samme forhold som bogstavet p har med lydene [p ∞] og [bÃ•], har bogstavet k med lydene [k ∞] og [gÃä] (k udtales [k ∞] i kage, men [gÃä] i skabe og tak), og bogstavet t med lydene [tÀ¢] og [dÃ•] (t udtales [tÀ¢] i tabe, men [dÃ•] i stole og skat). Danske konsonantlyde kan inddeles i fem kategorier Lukkelyde H√¶mmelyde Nasaler Likvider Halvvokaler. Der er et meget godt website Sproget.dk, hvor man kan finde detaljer om konsonantlyde.

posts.title: Machine learning -linear regression
posts.excerpt: Linear regression Generally, in regression analysis, you usually consider some phenomenon of interest and have a number of observations. Each observation has two or more features. Following the assumption that (at least) one of the features depends on the others, you try to establish a relation among them.
posts.text: Linear regression Generally, in regression analysis, you usually consider some phenomenon of interest and have a number of observations. Each observation has two or more features. Following the assumption that (at least) one of the features depends on the others, you try to establish a relation among them. In other words, you need to find a function that maps some features or variables to others sufficiently well. The dependent features are called the dependent variables, outputs, or responses. The independent features are called the independent variables, inputs, or predictors. Typically, you need regression to answer whether and how some phenomenon influences the other or how several variables are related. For example, you can use it to determine if and to what extent the experience or gender impact salaries. $y=\beta_0 +\beta_1x_1 +‚Ä¶+\beta_rx_x+ùúÄ$ This equation is the regression equation. y is the dependent variable, ùë•‚ÇÅ, ‚Ä¶, ùë•·µ£ are the independent variables, ùõΩ‚ÇÄ, ùõΩ‚ÇÅ, ‚Ä¶, ùõΩ·µ£ are the regression coefficients, and ùúÄ is the random error. The estimated or predicted response, ùëì(ùê±·µ¢), for each observation ùëñ = 1, ‚Ä¶, ùëõ, should be as close as possible to the corresponding actual response ùë¶·µ¢. The differences ùë¶·µ¢ - ùëì(ùê±·µ¢) for all observations ùëñ = 1, ‚Ä¶, ùëõ, are called the residuals. Regression is about determining the best predicted weights, that is the weights corresponding to the smallest residuals. To get the best weights, you usually minimize the sum of squared residuals (SSR) for all observations ùëñ = 1, ‚Ä¶, ùëõ: SSR = Œ£·µ¢(ùë¶·µ¢ - ùëì(ùê±·µ¢))¬≤. This approach is called the method of ordinary least squares. The variation of actual responses ùë¶·µ¢, ùëñ = 1, ‚Ä¶, ùëõ, occurs partly due to the dependence on the predictors ùê±·µ¢. However, there is also an additional inherent variance of the output. The coefficient of determination, denoted as ùëÖ¬≤, tells you which amount of variation in ùë¶ can be explained by the dependence on ùê± using the particular regression model. Larger ùëÖ¬≤ indicates a better fit and means that the model can better explain the variation of the output with different inputs. The value ùëÖ¬≤ = 1 corresponds to SSR = 0, that is to the perfect fit since the values of predicted and actual responses fit completely to each other. A paragraph is simply one or more consecutive lines of text. In markdown source code, paragraphs are separated by two or more blank lines. In Typora, you only need one blank line (press Return once) to create a new paragraph. Press Shift + Return to create a single line break. Most other markdown parsers will ignore single line breaks, so in order to make other markdown parsers recognize your line break, you can leave two spaces at the end of the line, or insert <br/>. Polynomial regression $y=\beta_0+\beta_1x_1+\beta_2x_{1}^{2}+‚Ä¶+\beta_nx_{1}^{n}$ Dummy variables A dummy variable (is, an indicator variable) is a numeric variable that represents categorical data, such as gender, race, etc. Convert categorical variable into dummy/indicator variables and drop one in each category: 1> X = pd.get_dummies(data=X, drop_first=True)

posts.title: First Blog Ever
posts.excerpt: Why I want to start to write blog I came across this idea of writing blog to help me to memorize my daily work, life and so on. There are too many things happening everyday, and things are repeating from time to time, I realize I need to go back to the same thing I have been done, and need to re-use the same of amount of time to figure out how to do it. It is quite frustrating, and time-consuming. I hope this blog could help me to be more organized, and make my life easier.
posts.text: Why I want to start to write blog I came across this idea of writing blog to help me to memorize my daily work, life and so on. There are too many things happening everyday, and things are repeating from time to time, I realize I need to go back to the same thing I have been done, and need to re-use the same of amount of time to figure out how to do it. It is quite frustrating, and time-consuming. I hope this blog could help me to be more organized, and make my life easier. Where to start to write a blog I start to search online: what is the best website to write a blog! There are so many options. I started to try the most popular blog designer WordPress.org, there are so many steps to set up, and after trying to install all the software, at the end I give up, I think it is not really for beginners. Then I also tried WIX, it is easy to start, and have many options to make the blog looks very nice, but I could focus with too many options. ALL I want to have is a straightforward website where I could just easily note down what I have been done. Then I came across a webpage where people share their experience and knowledge of living in Denmark , which looks great, very clean, simple, and organized! Then I saw the logo of Hexo, that‚Äôs where I finally decided to start my first blog. How to set up Hexo Hexo is a great way to create a simple website. It works well for blogs, resume sites. It is already very popular and have many people used it for blogging, so very easy to find tutorials to set up Hexo. Just a short summary here: Step 1: Install Node.js (Check if success by enter node -v in CMD) Step 2: Install Git (Check if success by enter git --version in CMD) Step 3: Register a Git account, and create a new repository for storing the final created blog/web, gave a name of the repository end with .github.io Step 4: Install Hexo blog using NPM (typing npm i hexo-cli -g in CMD check if success by typing hexo -v Step 5: Clone Hexo blog field hexo init blog Step 6: Switch to the blog directory cd blog and npm install **Step 7: **Connect Git with local Open git bash, and type in the following lines separately git config --global user.name "yourGitUserName" git config -- global user.email "Email used for Git" ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "Email used for Git" Press **Enter ** three times, then the key has been generated in the location, go to the file and open the file ‚Äò.ssh/id_rsa.pub‚Äô by notepad, and copy everything in the file. Go to Github, and clik the profile image, and choose under the opened list-setting, and then choose ==SSH and GPG keys== to create a new SSH key, give a random name, and paste everything to the key box. Check if it is success by enter ssh -T git@github.com in Git bash, if it is the first time, then it will give the following warning Just choose ‚Äúyes‚Äù, then it will show the following message: So it is succesed! **Step 8: ** Change the address to git repositionary Under the blog folder generate in step 5, open the _config.yml file with notepad, and change the last part to the following, the repository is the one you create from step 3. Step 9 : Write a blog in the generated file source\_posts In the _posts folder, there a .md file, which you could rename to the name of your post, and write in text editor, such as Typora. Step 10: Publish generated blog by typing in hexo g and then hexo s if you want to preview, and finally hexo d to publish to the webpage you initiate in github.
